meanings.definition: To spread or scatter in a messy or disorganized way.
meanings.sent1: She was splatting paint on the canvas.
meanings.sent2: The children were splatting paint on the paper during art class.
meanings.sent3: The chef accidentally started splatting ingredients everywhere in the kitchen.
meanings.sent4: The rain was splatting against the window, creating a soothing rhythm.
meanings.sent5: The mud splatting on the ground made a satisfying sound.

meanings.definition: The sound or effect of something hitting a surface with a wet, messy noise.
meanings.sent1: The splatting of the tomato hitting the floor echoed in the kitchen.
meanings.sent2: I heard the splatting of the raindrops on the roof.
meanings.sent3: The splatting of the pancake batter on the hot griddle made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The splatting of the water balloon hitting the wall was surprisingly loud.
meanings.sent5: The splatting of the mud hitting the window was a messy sight.
